person.persName: John Boyd Huston (Winchester, Kentucky, and Lexington, Kentucky, attorney and politician)

body.p: Winchester, Kentucky, and Lexington, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Nelson County, Kentucky, native. Son of James Huston and Mary McKee Huston. Married to Mary J. Allen Huston on September 21, 1836. Married to Elizabeth Jackson Huston on December 21, 1854. Graduated from Centre College in 1833. Teacher at Walnut Hill in Fayette County, Kentucky. Assistant Instructor at Center College. Studied law under Judge Daniel Mayers and Joshua F. Bell. Graduated from Transylvania University in 1835. Admitted to bar. Practiced law in Winchester from 1837 to 1864. Member of the Whig Party. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1839 and from 1855 to 1859 and 1861 to 1863. Member of the Democratic Party. Speaker of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1855 to 1857. Member of the Board State Convention in 1861. Relocated to Lexington in 1864. Continued practice of law with William S. Downey.
